website_summaries.verdict: Easy to take on and off, these collars are great for quick-change classes. They work best with lower weight quantities or with screw-on bars.
pros: Cam clamp locks securely onto the bar
Made of high-strength nylon using casting and high-pressure processing
cons: These tend to slide when you put too much weight on them
Work well for exercises where you drop the bar

customer_reviews.title: Simply Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Best clamps yet!! My gym had clamps like these before but for some reason they all disappeared. So instead of letting the weight fall from my imbalance I decided to buy some of my own. They are really strong and able to hold really heavy weight. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Capili

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: Alright, they're great, it was worth it the wait, believe me i thought they were gonna be crappy but no, i tried them today with 365lbs deadlifting and they passed the test, i love them no doubt it was a great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: iFROSTY

customer_reviews.title: No More Clamp Hunting!
customer_reviews.text: Much better than clamps. Very solid, and quite possibly my favorite gym purchase of the year. I got tired of hunting for clamps in my gym, and with these, not only are they better, but they are easy to work with. Once you get the hang of these, you'll never want to use those metal clamps again. And for the price, it's a great investment. No more clamp hunting... just more reps! 💪😎👍
customer_reviews.author: HaydenTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great collars and a great company!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about these collars is great. They work exactly as they need to. They've held 5 plates in place just fine and I'm sure they can handle more but that I'll have to discover later. My package was misplaced by the post office but Iron Lab worked with me to get another set out ASAP. They made it as painless possible. 10/10 would and will order from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Hold on!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these collars for my Olympic weights. The first pair I got was slipping a lot. I contacted the seller and they were very helpful and sent me a replacement quickly. These collars are quick to remove and put on. Great holding power during working out. My buddies love these too. These are so much better than spring clips and are at a good price. Don't try abusing them by trying to force them off or testing its strength by trying to slide the weights on one side. Use these collars as they're meant to be used and you'll be glad you did. Great collars and great response from company.
customer_reviews.author: Vuong

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: These slide on the bar even when deadlifting just a few hundred pounds without dropping the weight to the floor or anything. I bought these because people said they used them with far greater weight but they're just not good enough for that. Even deadlifting 315 requires me to put on the set I bought and the set they sent me because I told them they don't hold. For a while I used them doubled up like that until now because one of them broke. Don't be cheap and spend the money on some decent ones
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Update, Jan 11th 2018: I am amazed with the customer service Iron Lab has shown. My first set of these collars broke immediately, and I left a bad review (below). Without me asking, this company sent me a brand new set! I was just going to use the old ones, but I had to change my review after Iron Lab did that. Thank you very much! Christmas 2017: The black release tabs broke after the first time using them. I literally did one single set of bench press and went to open the collars to add weight and the black tabs broke off and hit the floor. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Ames

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched from a standard barbell to an Olympic set and the only problem I had with the change was dealing with the new set's spring collars. I'm a 42 yo woman and have been lifting for a few years and consider myself to be stronger than most in my demographic but those things were a serious struggle. An acquaintance suggested I get this type of collar and I'm extremely happy I did. They are easy to use and I'm no longer wasting energy between sets futzing around with spring style collars. I also like the red color as it makes them easy to spot if I happen to set one down in the wrong spot.
customer_reviews.author: BookIt1976

customer_reviews.title: No carry bag included in my order
customer_reviews.text: Although advertised as shipping with a carry bag, a convenience for those who train at a commercial gym, the product arrived in a very compact box without the carry bag. No big as I train at home but possibly a concern who require the bag. The clamps are solid, grab well, but are a little bit stiffer than others I have purchased. I don't drop cleans or snatches so I can't say how these would hold up to hard use. At this price, they could easily be replaced if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: o1d_dude

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a CAP Barbell 20 in. Olympic Dumbbell Handle. I have also used metal screw clamps (provided with the handle), spring clamps, and similar-looking plastic/rubber clamps. This works as well as any plastic/rubber clamp I have used. Like my other plastic/rubber clamps, this takes 1 7/8" of bar space. That's more than the 1" for a spring clamp or screw clamp; so far, I have the space to spare. The grip is secure; I feel much safer than I do with screw clamps. Comparing to spring clamps, I feel about the same security, but this is much easier to attach.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Strong Grip!
customer_reviews.text: These Iron Lab clamps are great for any workout involving a standard 2" bar. I've been using these for about five months now, and they've been holding strong since I first used them back in January. I like these much better than the metal clamps, mostly because I can tuck them right up against the weight, limiting any movement. They're easy to slip onto the bar and lock down. Simply push down on the yellow tab, and the clamp will lock on using the thick rubber. When it's finally time to remove them, just press the black clip and yellow tab, and they'll pop right off.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Feel solid and well built. Initially to open them you need to push down on the black tabs but once you work them in you can just open and close them. Not an issue as much as just something to be aware of. I have lifted with them for about a month with “heavier weights” up to 500lbs on a bar and enjoy using them more than the metal spring clips I was using before. I looked up their weight I think it’s like under a pound but if you are very strict about adding exact amounts of weight on the bar, it’s worth considering that they are not an “even number of pounds”.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Soled

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use clamps
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy I found these clamps. I was so tired of trying to squeeze those metal spring clamps off of my barbell while working out, which wasted my time and energy. I have been using the clamps for a week straight and they haven't slipped or came loose. They are very secure and can withstand a lot of weight. They are very easy to slide on and off during your workout when you need to switch plates. I use these 4-5 times a week with the highest weight being 200lbs (deadlift). This product is and does exactly what it states and I'm definitely impressed
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Not for Heavy Lifters
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs. They didn't stay in place with a lot of weight. They were good with one plate on each side when doing deadlifts. I bought Muscle Blocks. Those held in place better but came used. Try a different brand. Also, the rubber part looked like it was starting to split when it came. It probably won't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Costing

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth taking with you to the gym.
customer_reviews.text: My least favorite thing about lifting weights was always the stupid barbell collars. You know, the ones you have to squeeze and wiggle to get them to even go on the bar? I bought 3 sets of these and they are hands down the best bar collars I've ever used. We have 2 olympic bars in our home gym and I gave the 3rd set to my daughter to take to the gym with her when she goes to lift. She said she's the envy of all when she pulls these out at the gym and everyone wants to know where to get them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Masterson

customer_reviews.title: Get the job done!
customer_reviews.text: The collars get the job done! Pros: * Work well - hold the weight in place Cons * Plastic clip is too small and I will break. Actually I have already broke it off one collar during the first use! I have to be more careful on the other three (I purchased two sets - 4 collars). However, it did not affect the performance of the collars - they still clip on tightly. It may become a problem with a lot of plates on the barbell but no one in our small women-only college gym will ever put more that 400 lbs on the bar bell. I took one start off due to this flaw.
customer_reviews.author: bon_leon

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly the way I hoped.
customer_reviews.text: My gym has been using the old type of metal squeeze collars (I'm sure there's a more technical term), and the owner recently bought a single pair of these collars in black. It worked very well, and figuring that this purchase was by mistake more than anything (he hasn't purchased another pair since) I bought a pair to have at my disposal at any time. The color red identifies the collars as being mine if anybody thinks I'm stealing gym equipment. Now I have no concern about going heavy as these collars do what collars should do. I'm sure I'll be buying a second pair before too long as I tend to superset barbell exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Ellis Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Grips bar tightly.  Very strong.  Easy, quick release.
customer_reviews.text: Grips bar tightly. Very strong. Easy, quick release. The normal spring collars at the gym would cause mild pain in the ends of my fingers.. Not bad, but as my grandmother accurately taught me, little sharp pains consistently allowed when we're younger will eventually lead to arthritis when we're older. She was right, and she died quite healthy in her mid-90s.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory for your weight set!
customer_reviews.text: OK. I bought these because I own a pair of spring clips for my weight set. My wife and daughter just started out on a weight training program, and both of them had issues removing the spring clips from the barbell to switch weights. I bought these to make life easier for them, and BOY do they! They work out fantastic as a replacement for spring clips. Easy to use, and light as all get out. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Olympic Bar Collars
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 pair of these for our home gym. We do a lot of deadlifting, back squats, cleans and after ony 10 uses they hold up very well. I also work in gyms and have noticed that after extensive use the resistance in the movement in these collars (which I prefer) becomes a bit lax. Don’t know how well they will do with durability compared to the basic spring collars. Other than that these work great for all the power lifting/olympic lifting we do. Great quality for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Not Only Do They Work Perfect But They Go With My Gym!
customer_reviews.text: These clamps are super easy to take off and put on and they clamp tight. I looked at other clamps specifically through RogueFitness where I purchased the majority of my equipment and the prices are high. These clamps are not only a good price but seem to be very good quality. Do yourself and favor and grab a set of these if you're looking for a set of olympic barbell clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough for serious lifting.
customer_reviews.text: They just are not strong enough for serious lifting. They probably are ok for benching if you keep it level, but I haven't used them much for that. They are nearly worthless on my smooth chrome dumbbells if you have more than 10#s on a side. I do have a curl bar with machine marks on the barrels, they seem to work ok on that. They are certainly quicker than the screw on collars, but no where near as secure. It is rare that I can get them on and off one handed, which I had hoped for. Overall they are just not as good as I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great Clips
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these collars for 3 ish months now and I use them 2-4 times a week for mostly Olympic lifting which results in dropping the bar from overhead a lot. I haven’t had any issues with them being loose yet. They slide on and off the bar easily and clasp without struggling. I got these because I hate the normal metal clips and gym clips get over used. These are awesome for the price- other name brands want to charge 2-3x this price for the same product. I would buy these clips/collars again!
customer_reviews.author: Shelli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grips for Olympic size Barbells
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grip. I tested these on my olympic barbell and curl bars and these have the perfect grip. They fit nicely and don't let the plates move. It's a little hard to press and release the levers but it might get better with time and usage. These are constructed at a high quality. I like the red color as well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gundala

customer_reviews.title: Gentleman's Collar
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Secure Quick Bright Cons: Feels like it loosens slightly over time/use Closing thoughts: This style of collar is sold by dozens of companies on Amazon. I've seen a few in person. I'm confident that they're all made by the same factory and just get a different silk-screen printed onto them before sale. I like using this style of collar. It's convenient and secure but I suspect the plastic will loosen too much over time and I'll need to replace them within 2-3 years. For ~$10, I think that's a fair deal.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy these
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. They work well. I didn't even notice the lock feature when I bought them. This is a plus to ensure safety. I take them to the gym with me because they have those annoying metal ones that cumbersome to deal with. In between sets it wastes energy wrestling with those types of clamps. These are easy to deal with especially since I pyramid my sets and swap weight frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Swan

customer_reviews.title: Tough and sturdy for the price
customer_reviews.text: It made of thick hard plastic but it’s better built than other inexpensive clamps I’ve ordered. These beat them by far, has a little clip to hold the latch in place and the inside rubber padding is very grippy. Got a defective one when it came and they reached out and sent me a replacement. So customer service, price, and quality? All 10 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Must Have in Gym Bag
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy a pair of pink collars after one pair was misplaced and another pair of collars were stolen at the gym. They are easy to find in my gym bag, but tricky to close with one hand on a barbell. I usually have to close the collars with two hands after adding or taking off plates. I do plan on buying a back up pair of collars just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Eloradanan

customer_reviews.title: Own your collars
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a gym rat most of my life. There are a few things that are universal pet peeves in the gym. Not enough safety collars is high on the list. I finally broke down and got my own pair of collars what a difference it has made in my the gym no more searching mismatched set and it really helps to cut down the time looking for items that less considerate members throw around.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Polillo

customer_reviews.title: Careful while using it.
customer_reviews.text: These are ok and not as good as the ones in the gym. I have these for a year and I found out the hard way that they are not as secure as I thought. I put these on my dumbbells once and held it vertically doing squats. The clamps were not able to hold 25lbs. After doing 6 squats, the clamps loosen or something and the weights fell out. There are a small crack on my floor. Luckily it was the floor and not my foot. However, if you are using it for deadlift, back squats, curls etc, they are ok. I am still using this and I will be more careful.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Small Retainer Broke Immediately
customer_reviews.text: Literally the first time I put these on a bar, the little thumb retainer opposite the large lever, which is used to lock the lever in place, broke off and/or broke enough to lose engagement with the lever. The construction of the clamp, itself, should be sufficient so that the lever doesn't unexpectedly pop open, but still... Honestly, I wasn't roughhousing or putting an overly large amount of pressure on it, so something that's intended to be used in a gym where it will inevitably be dropped and tossed about should be more robust or just remove the weak point altogether. I don't think I'd like the catch over time anyways
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable and much more affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I love these, and they’re so much better than the ones at my gym. They’re quick and easy to lock, and they stay put. I don’t have a lot of time to mess around, so these definitely get the job done. I use them for bench press, squats, deadlifts and even on the easybars. Don’t spend the money on the expensive brand, these work just as great.
customer_reviews.author: Wolftrax

customer_reviews.title: Works well, very sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: I've only had these a few weeks, but the product seems to be pretty durable and well built. There is no wiggle room between the joints and I haven't experienced any sliding on the barbell yet. That said, these are pretty new and I would expect they last a few years before reaching that point. Either way, I'm glad I bought these and are working as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Tosy

customer_reviews.title: Poor design. Slides with frequent use and doesn't adequately grip the bar.
customer_reviews.text: Held up well for a week or so, then started sliding at the first hint of plate motion. Not secure at all. I definitely wouldn't trust my safety to this. If the manufacturer included some traction insulation on the inside of the clamp to create some friction against the bar and a tighter seal it might actually work. I ended up going with these. Can't recommend them highly enough.  Been using them for a week now and they just don't move.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be working great. I really only use collars on my curl bar and had misplaced my metal coil collars after my move so decided to give these a try. They use rubber pads to hold the collar in place once locked down and actually seem to hold better than the old style coil collars. Pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: RAW

customer_reviews.title: Love Them
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition to my home gym. When I looked at the local sporting goods store and theirs were $30 I couldn't resist taking a chance on these. I agree with the positive reviews these are an excellent value. Easy to install and remove and has great retention strength. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Use these things all the time in the gym. They work perfectly. I don't have to wander around my gym looking for those asinine clamps that are always lying around in obscure places. None of them ever fit properly, you always have to different ones, just a disaster. But not with these bad boys. These will lock tight. Very light weight as well. Watch your fingers though, got my finger pinched locking them in.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Martin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, especially for the price. Tough plastic. I'm not loading up more than 2 45-lbs. plates on either side of the barbell, but so far it has been excellent. Easy to use. I hate the metal clamps, so this was the solution I wanted. I leave them in my gym bad so I have them on hand whenever I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! I was really tired of looking around for ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I was really tired of looking around for these at the gym and figured it was time to invest in my own. I used them yesterday to deadlift & weighted hip thrusts and they worked great. EXTREMELY STURDY. I am looking forward to using them when I squat this Sunday. (inexpensive too, you guys should just buy them!)
customer_reviews.author: Desiree G.

customer_reviews.title: Great collar's.
customer_reviews.text: They don't hold super strong against multiple drops from over head (I do crossfit) but are very easy to attach, re-attach. Slide off and on with no problem what so ever. I would recommend. They hold a tight fit for every day use. Much better than the squeeze spring collars or some of the other janky ones that barely get wide enough when loosened to pull of the bar!
customer_reviews.author: James Redden

customer_reviews.title: Super tight
customer_reviews.text: Due to this pandemic scenario, gym does not offer Barbell Collars as public parts. I just received yesterday and tried it this morning. This barbell collar works perfectly. The size matches standard 20-kg bar and it locks super tightly. I like it. Its price is good though.
customer_reviews.author: PolymanQ

customer_reviews.title: Stylish AND practical!
customer_reviews.text: Collars are light, snug, and have an intuitive locking and unlocking mechanism! These collars keep weight plates secure to the bar with seemingly no movement (weight plates tend to move during power cleans or deadlifts). I've used 315lbs of weight and the collars held up with no problem. Clasp is easy to use; Press the small tab to release the collar and close the big latch in the direction of the natural contour of the collar to close. The collars are lightweight as well! There were a variety of colors to choose from. I chose a black pair and a red pair. Both sets are well made and stylish. 10/10 highly recommend for your olympic bar needs!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: These are really great for everyday lifting, I am not a super hardcore gym goer, I go about 3-4 times a week and lift with the barbell regularly, my gym had these horrible old twisted spring clamps that I hated so much, so I ended up buying these and I have thanked myself everyday since, the quality is really good for the price, they are super easy to use and have two locking mechanisms so it’s really secure despite being a mainly plastic body. 100% recommended from me
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: EDIT 12/21/2018: These are the only clamps I use now. They've held up extremely well, still clamp tight, and show no wear or signs of aging. Highly recommend. They do the job they were designed for. I'm only giving them four stars because they can be a PITA to unclamp depending on what direction they were put on, but that's a fault of the design and not the build quality. I'm partial to the swing-style clamps when doing a routine that requires constant plate switching but these are great for heavy loads for deadlifts, etc. Good price, good build quality, good looks, good performance, OK functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Easy, reliable, great to have
customer_reviews.text: These are solid and simple to use. As far as I’ve seen/heard, every weightlifter at my gym owns or borrows a pair. Makes for one less headache when some the gym-owned clips from your favorite squat/deadlift rack are mysteriously missing. Also way easier to use than standard metal squeeze-clips!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Frakes

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and highly reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have minimal experience weight lifting with a barbell. (About 1 year. I’ve been doing resistance training with bodyweight, barbells, and kettlebells for 10 years.) I workout with a barbell and trapbar 3-5 days a week now, using 250-300 lbs for leg work (I’m in my 60s, so give me a break!). The Iron Lab collars have been utterly reliable, are extremely simple to use, and show no signs of wear at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Marqroberts

customer_reviews.title: Broken locking mechanism
customer_reviews.text: These do the job. However, i ordered 3 pair (6 total) and 3 collars had the plastic locking mechanism break off on the 1st day. The locking mechanism is poorly made. The collar still stays closed without it so i havent bothered to attempt a return. I hate to see so many great reviews and receive a defective product, but it happens
customer_reviews.author: buddhaz

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Super easy to click in place and keep the plates snug. I haven't put them to use in dropping a heavily loaded bar, but they kept plates in place for deadlifts. Would definitely recommend these over those common metal spring type collars.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Very happy so far
customer_reviews.text: First off I love the red color and quality of this clamp. I workout 4 days a week and I found my self clamping down on the bar even when I didnt really need to, but why not because! it's so easy to use and really keeps the plates from not moving. This was a great purchase
customer_reviews.author: OMG

customer_reviews.title: You’ll be glad you bought these
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product,saw these at my local gym and had to have some for my home gym also,ease of use off and on is it’s best feature for me have used these collars on lifts over 400lbs and haven’t ever seen any movement of plates so that’s pretty safe,a nice upgrade to any gym
customer_reviews.author: Todd Stroud

customer_reviews.title: These are a must have at the gym!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! No more struggles with the sori g loaded barbell clamps or searching in every corner of the gym for the run-away clamps that always seem to go missing. Keep these in my gym bag and they are a life saver. Super easy to use, have had them for at least a year now and still going strong. Highly recommend, especially for anyone that struggles with those annoying spring loaded clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Update Feb 2018: Still holding up well and I have no issues. I've had 385lbs on deads and have dropped last set from knees and had little to no movement. My initial thoughts on olympic lifts still stands though. I have used them for 8 workouts and I like them. Easy to get on and take off and hold the weight secure while lifting. I wouldn't recommend them for Olympic lifting but they're fine for the big 3 and their ilk.
customer_reviews.author: Leprechaun

customer_reviews.title: Much better than they look
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect from these but I don't think I'll go back to standard squeeze grip locks. Very easy to use and lock the weight into place firmly. Though releasing is a mild chore in that you have to squeeze the small black release tab while moving the lock in the other direction. That being said, I still swear by these.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Moreau

customer_reviews.title: Great!  these quick release/ quick to slide on collars are GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the garbage metal, squeeze in your palm, then spend 10 to 20 seconds inching them on to the bar... these quick release/ quick to slide on collars are GREAT!!! They open extra wide so they slide on and off in a second... no struggling with the squeeze metal collars anymore for me! Fast, easy, and I can get to working out so much more quickly! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Cascade25

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: My old bar had clamps that were metal rings with a screw in the middle, those were tedious to take on/off and even slipped some times when not tightened down hard on a new, factory oiled bar. These are 1000x better, way faster to take on and off and most importantly, no slipping.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Theriot

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Product does not hold well. A band uses for tension pulled a 25lb weight off (being held by this clip) and the weight fell on my face (Db pullovers). I posted a picture of my swollen eye to prove it but amazon removed it for some reason. Anyways, id avoid these and opt for something a bit more stable
customer_reviews.author: andrew schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the money. These are basically the rogue collars just made with cheaper material. They do tend to walk on deadlifts especially over 400lbs. This does not show up for squats and bench. These are a no brainer for those that need more support than a spring clip at a commercial gym. If they walk off when you arent looking, you are only out $10 and they will outperform everything else remotely near that price range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make changing weights a breeze with a set of these!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, can't believe I waited so long to invest in these things. They seem to be very sturdy and man does it make changing weights so much easier! No more fighting to get those stupid clamps off and on. Have recommended them and have had 2 friends purchase a set!
customer_reviews.author: bearymae74

customer_reviews.title: Barbell Collar
customer_reviews.text: This barbell collar works well for most lifts. However, it lacks the grip and tightness needed to secure the plates in place when you do deadlifts. You need to readjust the collar after every set. However for squats, bench, OHP, and rows, it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Timmy Lau

customer_reviews.title: fits perfectly. looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I had the annoying clamps that came with the weight set we recently purchased. Trying to deal with those clamps seriously pissed me off. I didn't think twice about ordering these. Received them today and immediately went to slide them on. It is such a game changer. They fit like a glove on my 2" 45lb Olympic bar. And it's fun to have a spunky color in a sea of gray/black/metal !
customer_reviews.author: triceramom99

customer_reviews.title: Work great, but don’t last
customer_reviews.text: Want to start by saying that these clamps are awesome compared to the standard gym clamps. I bought these because my gym didn’t have enough bar clips and I got tired of hunting them down. First time I used these they were awesome, but the securing clip broke after only two uses. They still hold alright but don’t lock anymore. For the price I paid they still work well, just expected them to last a bit longer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work, but they might not last forever. Update: They last.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but I'm not 100% sure about the lock. Seems like the little black part is a tiny bit flimsy, but they're held up fine so far. I feel like these may break at some point in the next year, but for now they work perfectly well. I'll update in a year. Hopefully they prove me wrong. If they're still in good condition, I'll add another star. Update: they're still great.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah Henry

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff
customer_reviews.text: They work. Once locked down, they aren't going to fall off. But they're too stiff when trying to open them. My Walmart clips open easily, with one hand, and slide is easily off. These require two hands to open even after you've opened the clip. Blah!
customer_reviews.author: Ronbow

customer_reviews.title: These collars get the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I can't stand going into the gym and having to "head hunt" for the gym provided barbell clamps that seem to always go missing whenever I need them. On top of that I am a big believer in safety first. Buying these collars was a great call. Easy to use, good fit and they easily stand out (I bought the red ones) so you don't forget to take them with you when you're done lifting. Seem sturdy and durable so will have to see how they hold up overtime. No complaints thus far. Would recommend to anyone looking for their own pair of barbell collars.
customer_reviews.author: amazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: Work great, never slip and doesn't pinch fingers
customer_reviews.text: The release is easy to maneuver with one hand. I like that it opens wide so you don't have to deal with stuttering removal from the bar. These are pretty tough as well, I have dropped them quite a bit and they're totally fine! Highly recommend over the gamble of bar locks you might find at the gym. Also, they're pink, which serves as a natural thievery deterrent.
customer_reviews.author: Katya

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 pairs...and I’m about to buy a third!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second pair of these. I got one in all black. We love em! Actually realized I forgot to leave a review and was reminded cause I was about to buy a third for my Farmer’s Carry handles. My weight never shifts and it’s well worth the price. Wish I could rate it higher.
customer_reviews.author: King Mars

customer_reviews.title: Love these things!
customer_reviews.text: These are so much nicer than traditional olympic spring collars. Some springs collars I have are cheap and flimsy or you have to grip them a good bit at a weird angle when weights are on your bar to move them. These make life so much easier and fee much more secure. Do yourself a favor and get more than one set. Colors come in handy so you can spot them easily.
customer_reviews.author: Durty Derek

customer_reviews.title: First timer
customer_reviews.text: Thisbis the first time I used clamps like this and I'm amazed. Very easy to use, seems durable thus far and very little effort to lock weight in place compared to the standard butterfly clamps. Good price for product as well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These are a lot sturdier than I was expecting given some of the reviews. These feel just as good as the ones I was used to using at the gym for a fraction of the cost. And can’t argue with the awesome color choices
customer_reviews.author: serwin03

customer_reviews.title: $10 to not have to use gym clamps
customer_reviews.text: Can't stand looking around the gym for broken clamps only to find them being used by someone benching 50lbs like a clown. Do yourself a favor and spend 10 bucks and never worry again. They stay rock solid with 400+ deadlift no issue at all.
customer_reviews.author: Riley & Gen

customer_reviews.title: If you have an Olympic bar, you NEED these...
customer_reviews.text: Love this product.. Easy to use and durable... We all work out at my house and everyone is extremely happy with these... Don’t mess with those old school collars.. Get the best... I did!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a certified personal trainer who has been using Olympic bars for years! These by far are the best safety clips I've ever used. Being a female, the average chrome clips rust too easy and become stiff and become hard for me to open. These are perfect for ladies hands. Awesome and highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fast to use
customer_reviews.text: I love these types of collars as opposed to the traditional metal spring ones at the gym. These collars are just nice, quick and easy to use which is important when you want to change plates quickly. The spring ones are always messed up at the gym; either too tight to put on quickly, or too loose and won't hold the plates. They are plastic and seems like it will last as long as you don't abuse them, like always dropping the bar from deadlifting, jerking, etc. Get them if you aren't throwing weights around.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: They do just what they're supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: They hold weights securely on the bar. Easy to get on and off, and after about 2 months of use, show no signs of wearing out or breaking. Bonus point for coming in blue and matching the blue trim on my half-rack.
customer_reviews.author: DrewSP

customer_reviews.title: They work! They're exactly what you're looking for.
customer_reviews.text: They are barbell collars that fit snug and tight. Sometimes they are hard to take off which is good, my preference is to not die in some horrible weightlifting accident. Looking for some barbell collars? These work and get the job done. If they break because you're slamming your weights, stop slamming your weights; different case if you're doing Olympic lifts, in that case, do it on a platform. Don't be a moron, these clamps will last.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Chung

customer_reviews.title: Too stiff
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, returned immediately. Very difficult to open compared to similar products. 1 of 2 barely fit on the bar. But on a positive, the color was spot on from the photo. I previously ordered a pair from clout fitness and am going to order another set to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Knock off Quality
customer_reviews.text: Just spend the couple extra dollars and buy Lock-Jaw brand name. These don’t open or close easily, on just one of mine the black secondary locking clip does nothing, I can pull the tab up while it’s supposed to be locked. These take two hands to open and close as they don’t operate smoothly, while my real Lock-Jaw’s just take one hand. The only reason this gets two stars is because once it is clamped, they do hold tight.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas B

customer_reviews.title: Great clamps!
customer_reviews.text: I do CrossFit everyday and when we have workouts that require a quick change in weight spring clips are arduous and a hassle. These clips are light weight, fit snug, and keep your plates from sliding even when dropped from a high position.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Price

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for deadlifts
customer_reviews.text: My biggest concern when I was using this clip was how stable it was at handling larger weights. The construction of this clip is plastic and rubber, so I didn't think it was durable. I managed to deadlift 225 pounds and the weights didn't shift. It was still secure after I was done with my sets.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Great Clamps
customer_reviews.text: received the item as described. well made. a little sticky to pry open at first which is also a good thing coz it sure will hold the plates in place. liked the color blue .. motivating to do more reps :) ... highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M2A

customer_reviews.title: I am very satisfied with my purchase and the performance of the collars
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would try something other than a spring clip collar. I am very satisfied with my purchase and the performance of the collars. The collars are very secure. On a couple occasions I have had to slide under the bar on a failed bench attempt in the rack. I was able to pick up the bar, one side at a time, and the weight did not slide off of the "down" collar. It did not slide at all. There was over 100lbs on that side of the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Robert  J Lee

customer_reviews.title: Material used
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised they were plastic, for some reason I was under the impression that some type of alloy would be used. Having said that they are well made and as of today they have performed as advertised. Quite pleased with my purchased and the pricing is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos E. Galvez

customer_reviews.title: Super grip
customer_reviews.text: Super grip. These things dont move. Was benching and I failed my last rep had to push the bar off my chest to one side. The weights stayed in place throughout the whole ordeal. Not sure if it was a good thing or a bad thing lol but they held the weight in place so I guess they did their job.
customer_reviews.author: danny

customer_reviews.title: I did not receive the initial order
customer_reviews.text: I initially ordered the collar locks on my old amazon account, which had a previous shipping address from 6 years ago. When I noticed the error, I was informed that it was too late to cancel or reverse shipment. As yet I do not know what happened to the collars. Subsequently my wife ordered new collars through her E. Sue Woodward prime account and the collars were delivered the within two days. They work great and I am pleased. It would be interesting to know what happened to my initial order. Gregg Woodward
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great general purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, fast and sturdy for general use. Not for heavy reps on the deadlift or any other floor impacting movements with multiple reps. For all other applications, these are my go to clamp.
customer_reviews.author: my view

customer_reviews.title: Works like it is designed to
customer_reviews.text: I used to have the winged metal clamps that require you to squeeze the daylights out it to get it off the bar. These are a great replacement, they are pretty inexpensive and do the job. I would recommend this barbell collar or any similar collar mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry Searle

customer_reviews.title: It's a true fat grip bar, 1.90 so you need the screw clamps
customer_reviews.text: It's a real fat grip dumbell. The real deal at 1.90 inch thick all metal. Definitely need scow down collars. Its hollow and one piece , a chain will fit through easily. The perfect thing for working grip on pulling exercises. Its awesome . Now I'm looking for some hooks to fit it
customer_reviews.author: walter mcmahon

customer_reviews.title: Loosened up and almost injured myself third time using
customer_reviews.text: These looked promising but after only my third time using them they loosened up and the weight slid off my bar. Almost injured myself maybe a defective unit. Not a lot of weight on the bar either, 2 45lb plates. Really disappointed
customer_reviews.author: James_c_l

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These collars are simple and easy to use. Before these I had never used anything other than spring collars but these are actually better. My only concern is that of durability (hence the 4 stars) because they are mostly plastic. Only time will tell!
customer_reviews.author: Coach Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Holds and has held up
customer_reviews.text: Nice clamp. Good clamp pressure. Keeps weight shift from hamping. I use on my deadlift bar fo it goes on and off alot during a sesion for adding weight and it has held up well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have the YOKE bar from Elitefts, which normal spring collars do not fit. Based off a recommendation from one of my friends, I bought a pair of these collars and they work exceptionally well! If anyone has used Lock Jaw collars, you know they work well BUT they also cost a pretty penny. These collars deliver the same performance and quality that Lock Jaw collars do but at a fraction of the price. Highly recommend these to anyone looking for a great set of collars at a bargain price!
customer_reviews.author: Clark Yow

customer_reviews.title: Great barbell collar
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It's light, easy to use, and clamps well on to the bar. Even when not locked it has a solid clamp. It's much easier to use than those metal spring clamps that get rusty, slippery, and and stuck on rusty bars. These clamps slide on and off easily and quickly. They keep the plates on tight, even when doing deadlifts where the plates are hitting the ground repeatedly. I recommend these to any serious lifter.
customer_reviews.author: Listen

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 sets
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I lift together at least 4 days a week. We mainly do olympic lifts and these clamps work great. I got tired of trying to look for clamps at the gym so I bought a set for each of us a few months ago. Have had no issues with grip or quality at all.
customer_reviews.author: Roze Gritten

customer_reviews.title: Well built ans sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I bought a similar set that was a little more expensive. These are sturdier and better constructed. I feel confident that they will hold my son's 450# plus deadlifts. They were a bit stiff at first, but that's not really a bad thing. I will likely buy more of these.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: So easy to put on and remove
customer_reviews.text: Only had for over a month with light use. Holds plates on Olympic bar as intended. A bit pricey but it’s far more convenient then those old metal ones you had to pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Jusburnin_dc5

customer_reviews.title: Great and Clean product
customer_reviews.text: The clamp works great and is easy/comfortable to use. It did break on me when a 45lb plate fell on it, it I knew that could happen given the material it’s made of. It’s still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Castro

customer_reviews.title: Fits Olympic Barbell
customer_reviews.text: Great fit on our olympic bar, snug fit. They are a bit stiff new, opening and closing, but the fit on the bar is snug and secure, I"m sure over time with use it will loosen a bit in opening and closing while maintaining the security.
customer_reviews.author: NYRGirl1985

customer_reviews.title: It does what its supposed to do, great price
customer_reviews.text: For what this does and the price point, you can't beat it. I'm careful with my gear, this should last. I don't recommend tossing this around the gym, it might not stand up to rough abuse. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sensible_Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love these clips. I bought them to replace my metal spring clamps which were super difficult to use and these are much easier. They stay in place securely and they are easy to unlock.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Calvert

customer_reviews.title: Great collars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, hold pretty good. If you have more than a couple 45s on a side the collars can move a little bit nothing has come close to falling off. Overall they do the job well
customer_reviews.author: Dan A

product_meta.title: Iron Lab Olympic Barbell Collar Pair of 2" Inch Pro ABS Locking Set of 2 Black Clamps Perfect for Pro Crossfit Strong Lifts and Olympic Training Professional Quality
product_meta.description:
Quick change of the working weight. Forget the horrible spring collars and the useless waste of time. You will need just a few seconds to change the working weight. Your training sessions will become more intense, and you will be able to achieve better results. 

Safety. The special design of the collar ensures secure plate fixation on the bar. 

Reliability. Durable cast body and high-pressure grip pads make these collars virtually indestructible! 

Diameter: 2”. Works perfectly for CrossFit, Olympic weightlifting, heavy lifting and any training with an Olympic bar. 

Material: High-strength nylon. 

Warranty: If you are not satisfied with quality of the product, simply send us a letter and we will either replace it or give you a refund! 



Click «Add to Cart» and get your Barbell Collars right now!
feature_bullets: EASE OF USE ENABLES WORKING WEIGHT TO BE CHANGED QUICKLY. You no longer need to waste lots of time annoying yourself with unwieldy spring collars when changing the working weight. Training sessions will become much more pleasant.

SAFETY IS PARAMOUNT WHEN WORKING WITH WEIGHTS! Iron Lab collars were developed to withstand serious strains. The cam clamp locks securely onto the bar. You will feel much more confident and have more pleasant training sessions.

BARBELL CLAMPS MATERIAL: HIGH-STRENGTH NYLON. Iron lab collars are manufactured from high-strength nylon using casting and high-pressure processing. The simple clamp locks securely into place. The durable cast body and high-pressure grip pads make the collar virtually indestructible!

WARRANTY: making sure that you get a product of the highest quality is very important to us. Iron Lab provides a full warranty for all of its products. If you are not satisfied with the quality of your 2 inch Olympic barbell clamp, simply send us a letter and we will either replace it or give you a refund as soon as possible.
HURRY, THE PRICE WILL INCREASE SOON! In Order to Get Your Barbell Collars Right Now, Click «Add to Cart»!
